description.p: Cataclysm: Bright Nights is a roguelike with sci-fi elements set in a post-apocalyptic world.

While some have described it as a "zombie game", there is far more to Cataclysm than that. Struggle to survive in a harsh, persistent, procedurally generated world. Scavenge the remnants of a dead civilization for food, equipment, or, if you are lucky, a vehicle with a full tank of gas to get you the hell out of there.

Fight to defeat or escape from a wide variety of powerful monstrosities, from zombies to giant insects to killer robots and things far stranger and deadlier, and against the others like yourself, who want what you have.
Find a way to stop the Cataclysm ... or become one of its strongest monsters.

Cataclysm: Bright Nights is a fork of Cataclysm: Dark Days Ahead. The two forks diverged a few years ago over disagreements regarding the right direction for development to take, with BN choosing less emphasis on realism. Overall, BN has taken a more Sci-Fi approach, with robots and bionics still prominent in society.

ul.li: Improved monster AI, including a "Stockfish" AI mod for extra challenge
Added a new GPS item to allow for searching for map tiles easier
Reworked how the drug system works, mods can add cigarettes properly now
Rebalanced weapon handling, primarily nerfs
Converted more tool requirements to quality requirements for modability
Reworked the loot tables of supply drops to make them less of power pinatas
Color-coded the charge amounts in the inventory
Added a total armor section to armor layering menu
Rest of the changes can be found in the github repo
Obsoleted No Hope and Generic Guns
Stamina affects dodge rating and melee damage instead of movecost
Audited basic-tier blacksmithing
JSONized activity movecost and modifiers
More bionics cancel out bad traits
Fixed some accidental cannibalism nutrients in food
Prevent item shortcuts in the inventory resetting
Rest of the changes can be found in the github repo
Added new LUA bindings.
Improved autodrive.
Reworked vehicles collision system.
More built in mods.
Added more survivor gear.
Added 3D printers.
Zombie masters are reworked to give buffs to zombies.
Added weapon kill tracking.
Rest of the changes can be found in the github repo
